description: Available Python tools for Roscoe agent. Tools are callable via python_execute.

tools.name: internet_search
tools.description: Search the internet using Tavily API for current information, medical definitions, and general research.
examples: python /Tools/research/internet_search.py "Kentucky personal injury statute of limitations" --max-results 5

tools.name: pubmed_search
tools.description: Search PubMed for medical literature and research articles.

tools.name: read_pdf
tools.description: Extract text content from PDF files, optionally specific pages.
tools.output_format: Text or JSON with page content

tools.name: search_case_law
tools.description: Search case law databases for relevant legal precedents.

tools.name: expert_witness_lookup
tools.description: Research expert witness background, publications, and prior testimony.

tools.name: chronology_add_term
tools.description: Add a researched medical term to the local cache with proper citation. Use after researching a term with internet_search.
tools.usage: python /Tools/medical_chronology/chronology_add_term.py --term TERM --definition DEFINITION --source SOURCE --url URL [--category CATEGORY]
examples: python /Tools/medical_chronology/chronology_add_term.py --term "Cervical Radiculopathy" --definition "Compression or irritation of nerve root in cervical spine causing pain and numbness radiating to arm." --source "Mayo Clinic" --url "https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/radiculopathy"

python /Tools/medical_chronology/chronology_add_term.py --term "ACDF" --definition "Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion - surgical procedure to remove damaged disc and fuse vertebrae." --source "Cleveland Clinic" --url "https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/treatments/22154-acdf" --category procedures
tools.output_format: JSON with status and entry added

tools.name: chronology_lookup_term
tools.description: Look up a medical term in the local research cache. Returns definition and citation if found, or indicates research is needed.
tools.output_format: JSON with definition, source, url, or needs_research flag

tools.name: chronology_analyze_terms
tools.description: Analyze medical text to identify terms that need definition. Returns cached terms, terms needing research, and standard abbreviations.
examples: python /Tools/medical_chronology/chronology_analyze_terms.py --text "Patient diagnosed with cervical radiculopathy and underwent ACDF procedure."
tools.output_format: JSON with cached_terms, needs_research, and abbreviations lists

tools.name: chronology_generate_pdf
tools.description: Generate a professional medical chronology PDF from structured entry data. Requires reportlab library.
tools.usage: python /Tools/medical_chronology/chronology_generate_pdf.py --client-name NAME --dob DATE --injury-date DATE --entries-json PATH --output DIR [--firm-name NAME] [--source-records PATH]
tools.output_format: JSON with path to generated PDF and any warnings

tools.name: chronology_merge_with_records
tools.description: Merge the generated chronology PDF with source medical records PDF, creating a combined document. Requires PyPDF2 library.
tools.output_format: JSON with path to combined PDF

tools.name: calendar_add_event
tools.description: Add an event to the calendar (deadlines, appointments, etc.).
tools.usage: python /Tools/calendar/calendar_add_event.py --title TITLE --date DATE [--time TIME] [--description DESC] [--case-id ID]
examples: python /Tools/calendar/calendar_add_event.py --title "SOL Deadline" --date 2025-04-26 --description "2-year statute of limitations" --case-id mills_amy

tools.name: calendar_list_events
tools.description: List upcoming calendar events, optionally filtered by case.

categories.research: Tools for searching external sources (internet, medical literature, case law)
categories.documents: Tools for reading and processing documents
categories.legal: Tools for legal research and expert analysis
categories.medical_chronology: Tools for building professional medical chronologies
categories.calendar: Tools for managing case deadlines and events
categories.ui: Tools for generating reports and visualizations

usage_notes.research_workflow: 1. Use internet_search or pubmed_search to find information. 2. Use chronology_add_term to cache findings with citation. 3. Use chronology_lookup_term before researching to avoid duplicates.
usage_notes.chronology_workflow: 1. Extract records with read_pdf. 2. Analyze terms with chronology_analyze_terms. 3. Research needed terms with internet_search. 4. Add to cache with chronology_add_term. 5. Generate PDF with chronology_generate_pdf. 6. Optionally merge with records using chronology_merge_with_records.
